samples.context: Bacteria are the simplest and one of the oldest organisms on the earth. Their simple body design does not make them weak from any angle.
samples.question: Why are bacteria considered simple organisms?

samples.context: Many scientific investigations have shown that the modern humans evolved in Africa. They migrated towards north; in due course of time and settled near what is known as the Mediterranean Sea.
samples.question: Where did modern humans evolve according to scientific investigations?

samples.context: The modern humans are called Homo sapiens. They migrated in different directions from that area after the ice age ended.
samples.question: What are modern humans scientifically classified as?

samples.context: When the ice age ended, melting of ice resulted in the rise in water level. The humans migrated in different directions from that area.
samples.question: What caused humans to migrate in different directions?

samples.context: Evolution does not mean progress in every case. This can be proved by example of bacteria.
samples.question: Does evolution always indicate progress?
